text: The 2018–19 Montenegrin Cup was the 12th edition of the football tournament in Montenegro. The cup began on 28 August 2018 and ended on 30 May 2019. The winners of this competition earned a place in the UEFA Europa League. OFK Titograd Podgorica won the previous season's tournament (under the name Mladost Podgorica), and were the defending champions. The club defeated Igalo in the final by the score of 2–0. ==Format== Twenty–six clubs participated in the competition this season. The first round and the final were contested over one leg with all other rounds being contested over two legs. ==First round== The first round matches were played on 28–30 August 2018. ==Second round== Fourteen clubs competed in the second round played over two legs from 3 to 24 October 2018. ===First legs=== ===Second legs=== ==Quarter–finals== The quarter–finals were played from 7 to 28 November 2018. ===First legs=== ===Second legs=== ==Semi–finals== The semi–finals were played from 17 April to 1 May 2019. ===First legs=== ===Second legs=== ==Final== ==See also== * Montenegrin Cup * Montenegrin First League ==External links== * Football Association of Montenegro – Official Site * Cup at UEFA ==References== 2018-19 Montenegro Cup
title: 2018–19 Montenegrin Cup
